intro: Chiclea cortesiana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant, often purple or blue flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Chiclea cortesiana is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
